meanings.sent1: She carefully practiced her instrokes in calligraphy class.

meanings.sent3: During the game of Pictionary, his instrokes were so exaggerated that everyone burst into laughter.

meanings.definition: A sudden or brief influx or increase.
meanings.sent1: The instrokes of customers during the holiday season kept the store busy.
meanings.sent2: There was a noticeable instrokes of excitement when the surprise guest arrived.
meanings.sent3: The instrokes of rain caught everyone off guard during the outdoor event.
meanings.sent4: The instrokes of generosity from the community were heartwarming.
meanings.sent5: The instrokes of applause filled the concert hall after the breathtaking performance.
